abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and modest institutional
            development impacts, including satisfactory ratings on
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower. This experience
            suggests that more attention needs to be given to the
            sequencing of reforms. The Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC) program was perhaps too overloaded with
            "politically-sensitive" reforms, i.e., public
            sector, welfare, labor, and land reforms; rather a more
            phased approach could have been more manageable. Thus,
            further consideration should also be given towards ensuring
            wide-base political support for key reforms, and avoid
            interruptions every time there is a change in government.
            This is why governments need to be encouraged to pursue
            reforms that have bipartisan support, i.e., to enhance
            consultations with relevant stakeholders, including within
            government. Other lessons address the recent poverty
            numbers, which show a sharp increase in inequality between
            1990-91 and 2002, also reinforcing the importance of
            focusing on pro-poor reforms, e.g., welfare reforms and
            rural development, to be the center of the second PRSC
            operation. Moreover, it is important that future PRSC
            operations be closely linked to the budget, and, given the
            difficulties in passing legislative changes, should legal
            changes be included in the program, careful consideration
            needs to be given to the constitutionality of the proposed
            legislations, and whether they could withstand court
            challenges. Unfortunately, while this operation did
            (substantially) achieve its objectives, the results are much
            less satisfactory than they would have been if the intended
            complementary reforms, originally planned to be supported in
            subsequent operations, had actually materialized.
